com.qtplaf.library.app

Class Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qtplaf.library.app.Session

  • public class Session
extends java.lang.Object
    A session manages the featurs related to one user executing one instance of the system. The selected locale, the user and its rights, all are features packaged in the session.

    Wherever a locale, user rights of any other user feature, the session will be required.

    In a swing application, one session will be created at start time after logon, and this will be the unique session managed by the application.

    In a WEB application, normally under the execution of an HttpSevlet, mainly using the session of an HttpServelRequest, many sessions will be available, each one corresponding the every detached request.

    Author:
    Miquel Sas
